Question: John likes to have lightly flavored tea every evening. In a 50% strong milk tea, he replaces 15% of it with milk twice. Then, he replaces 10 percent of the resultant solution with more milk.
What is the final concentration of tea John drinks?
Choices:
  A: 15.38%
  B: 42%
  C: 39.86%
  D: 22.35%
  E: 32.51%

Reflection:
I made a calculation error when determining the final concentration of tea. I incorrectly multiplied the percentages instead of using the formula for successive dilutions.

Thought:
First, John replaces 15% of the 50% strong milk tea with milk, resulting in a concentration of 50% \* (1 - 0.15) = 42.5%.
Then, he replaces 15% of the resultant solution with milk again, resulting in a concentration of 42.5% \* (1 - 0.15) = 36.125%.
Finally, he replaces 10% of the resultant solution with milk, resulting in a concentration of 36.125% \* (1 - 0.1) = 32.5125%.
